alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kanawha (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 10:51AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Kanawha and southwestern Clay Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1050 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms over Coal Fork, or near Charleston, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor water problems could occur. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Clendenin, Pinch, Coal Fork, Elkview, Glen and Procious. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 near mile marker 5. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 97. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 92 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
